page.title: 20LOW FLYING AIRCRAFT
page.content: {Twice a day we are disturbed by low {flying aircraft which come mainly from {R.A.F.Church Fenton and R.A.F. {Finningley.}These are mostly Tornadoes but occasionally we see Jaguars,Jet Provosts and large American A-10's. The R.A.F. told us that they had to fly low for pilot training so that in the event of war they would be prepared and could act swiftly.They experience problems because of the overcrowded air space.Flights cannot be made near British Civil Airspace so they have to use the most suitable space available. {Both R.A.F. bases receive one {complaint a week on average,}but most people seem to realise the importance of low flying and don't complain.We often hear them at school but we are used to the noise now and don't notice it sometimes.
